intro: Pachyanthus shaferi, commonly known as the golden star tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface. The fruit is a smooth, green drupe that turns yellow when ripe, containing a single seed.
